title: I Open League on My Mac, But it just bumps up and then goes unresponsive.
body: So this is my Issue, have had it for a week now, cant fix it looked in all other forums but no. Tried uninstalling and Reinstalling, nothing works. Have A ticket in with Rito, however if anyone has any fixes or tips that worked for them would be incredibly grateful.

replies.body:
Hey there,

Could you tell me what version of OSX you're running? If El Capitan, there are currently some known issues with many applications not working correctly.

Do you have a Time Machine backup prior to your upgrade to El Capitan?
how do i check if I'm running El Capitan. Im pretty sure i was running Yosemite.

Thanks for confirming you're not running El Capitan in your post below.

Have you attempted to reinstall your game yet? [Here](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202539040-Reinstalling-League-of-Legends#section-mac) is a guide on how to accomplish a fresh reinstall of the game.

Let me know if this helps
Says Support is down for me, cant connect.

Ok, that sounds like you're also having issues with your DNS. Please follow the steps below to resolve this.

**CHANGING TO PUBLIC DNS**

* Open System Preferences
* Open the Network preference pane
* Select the active connection on the left, and click the "Advanced..." button in the lower right hand corner
* Click "DNS" from the selection bar.
* Remove any current DNS entries, and input the following public DNS servers:

> 8.8.8.8 
> 8.8.4.4

* Save your changes by selecting "OK"
* Apply the changes by clicking "Apply" in the lower right hand corner

After you've completed the above steps please attempt to launch the game again, if you are still unable to launch the client follow the steps in my previous post to reinstall the client.
thank you for answering with a fix sadly i am unable to actually change to public dans as my mac is admin locked. :( do u you think that riot will fix this.

The issue with loading the page isn't on Riot's end.

I suggest you gain assistance from your computer's administrator :)

For those wondering I'm Running OS X Yosemite vs 10.10.3

Macbook Air (13-inch, Early 2014)
1.4Ghz Inter Core i5
4 GB 1600 MHz DDR3
Intel HD Graphics 5000 1536 MB
